title.rendered: The Beauty Expert “Donna Fay” Has the Scoop on Beauty for Men

content.rendered:
Under eye wrinkles, crow’s feet, whatever you like to call them, one thing is for sure:  They make you look old and tired. Although these wrinkles in men are part of the natural aging process, there are a lot of anti-aging resources available to help you get rid of under eye wrinkles. But before we get into the best tips to get rid of crow’s feet, here’s a little more background information on crow’s feet.

What Are Crow’s Feet?
Crow’s feet are wrinkles around eyes that form as a result of a number of factors, smoking, and everyday facial expressions are just two reasons for their appearance. These eye wrinkles are named as such because of their appearance: the fine lines resemble crow’s feet. Unlike other wrinkles, undereye wrinkles require special attention because they reside in the delicate skin around eyes.

This is where Botox comes to your rescue.The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved a new use for Botox Cosmetic (onabotulinumtoxinA) for the temporary improvement in the appearance of moderate to severe lateral canthal lines, also known as crow’s feet, in adults. Botox is the only FDA approved drug treatment option for lateral canthal lines.
Here are some  great anti-aging tips for men, you’ll stay looking young and maintain your youthful complexion for years to come by getting rid of crow’s feet.

 1. Use protection. Sun damage is a leading cause for premature aging signs and that includes eye wrinkles. Protect your eyes by wearing sunglasses when outside for an extended period of time. It’s also helpful to use a men’s moisturizing sunblock to protect against UVA/UVB rays that could contribute to under eye wrinkles and other skin issues like age spots.

2. Stop squinting. As mentioned earlier, facial expressions can contribute to the formation of under eye wrinkles. Let’s be realistic, though: You’re not going to be walking around emotionless for the rest of your life laugh, and smile to your heart’s content. There is one thing you can work on, however, and that’s squinting. Make sure you wear sunglasses outside and get the right prescription for your glasses if you need them. If you’re having trouble focusing, you can also change your location (e.g. movie theater). The ultimate goal is to reduce eye strain.

3. Drink more. Water, that is. Drinking enough water is crucial to healthy skin and keeps moisture levels balanced. A lack of moisture can lead to dry skin, which result in premature aging signs in men like crow’s feet.

4. Use only the best men’s anti-aging skin products for men. The skin around eyes should not be exposed to just any anti-aging skin products for men. This is delicate skin and it can become easily irritated because it’s so thin. That’s why it’s important to invest in only the best men’s anti-aging creams that contain retinol. Studies have shown that retinol, a vitamin A derivative is one of the most effective ingredients to fight aging signs like eye wrinkles.
